title: Incorrect Default Desktop Audio device (picks up microphone instead) on profile change or application start
body:
## Platform
Operating system and version:
Ubuntu Server 18.04 Bionic Beaver

OBS Studio version:
25.0.8 64 bit

## Expected Behavior
Upon application start or settings profile change, the default sound device for "Desktop Audio" should be, well, desktop audio on Linux. 


## Current Behavior
Even while leaving the Device on "Default", the effect of this setting is not necessarily consistent across application and computer restarts. 

Upon application start or profile change, microphone input is improperly picked up instead of Desktop Audio in the audio mixer, and the expected ;desktop audio' is almost completely inaudible. 

(I couldn't get a log file, but I have two example videos that demonstrate the issue):

Video demonstrating issue:
https://www.twitch.tv/videos/688793653

Video where microphone was picked up instead of Desktop audio (not the one where I read out my Social Security number on livestream by accident! Please fix this thx!):
https://www.twitch.tv/videos/689462361

## Steps to Reproduce
Video Example
https://www.twitch.tv/videos/688793653

1. On Ubuntu Bionic Beaver 18.04 bit and OBS 25.0.8 64 
2. Plug in an analog audio device
3. Plug in a USB microphone (USB PnP Audio Device, in my case a FIFINE Studio Condenser T669) 
4. (unknown) have one or more USB microphones and/or audio output devices plugged in after
5. Start, Restart, or switch profiles on OBS and begin streaming

(unknown) order of steps 4 and 5 or if this is a factor

Successful Reproduction of Issue:
Microphone audio will be picked up instead of Desktop Audio. Expected Desktop Audio will be either completely mute or nearly inaudible. 

## Additional information
May be related to push to talk and push to mute functionality, but I believe I've been encountering this issue before using these settings.
